New Records: Cade Cunningham matched Grant Hill for the longest triple-double streak in franchise history.
Cunningham’s fifth career triple-double, tying Isiah Thomas for the second-most in franchise history
Key Match Events: Cade Cunningham scored the winning basket with 8.5 seconds left
Trae Young gave the Hawks their first lead of the game at 121-120 with 12.5 seconds left
Cunningham blocked Onyeka Okongwu's shot as time expired
Post-Match Reflections: The Pistons built their big first-half lead with very little scoring help from Cade Cunningham.
The Hawks trailed by as many as 24 points in the first half, but they tied the game on Dyson Daniels’ floater with 3:36 to play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hawks outscored Detroit 98-82 in the final three quarters.
Detroit led 99-88 early in the fourth quarter, but Larry Nance Jr. dunked in traffic and hit a 3-pointer to get the Hawks within six with 9:05 left.
Others: Cade Cunningham finished his third consecutive triple-double by scoring the winning basket with 8.5 seconds left, and the Detroit Pistons beat the Atlanta Hawks 122-121 on Friday night.
